name: Psychedelia
description: Umbrella of styles intended to replicate or enhance the altered state of consciousness brought on by the use of psychedelic drugs, originating in the 1960s.

sub_genres.name: Neo-Psychedelia
sub_genres.description: Developments in Psychedelia since the early 1980s, building on the drug-inspired styles developed in the 1960s.

sub_genres.name: Psychedelic Folk
sub_genres.description: Acoustic forms that capture an atmosphere that is at turns dream-like, 'spaced-out', whimsical, haunting, mystical, and melancholic.

sub_genres.name: Psychedelic Pop
sub_genres.description: Combines unconventional instrumentation with studio effects to create a psychedelic atmosphere within melodic Pop music.

sub_genres.name: Psychedelic Rock
sub_genres.description: Rock which emerged in the mid-1960s that often attempts to emulate or enhance the effects of psychedelic drugs.

sub_genres.name: Psychedelic Soul
sub_genres.description: Soul which incorporates the effects and instrumentation of Psychedelic Rock.

sub_genres.name: Psychsploitation
sub_genres.description: Short-lived genre seeking to capitalise on the popularity of Psychedelia in the 1960s, featuring quickly and cheaply recorded material played by session musicians and put out by budget labels.

sub_genres.name: Stoner Metal
sub_genres.description: Combines elements of Doom Metal with elements of Psychedelic Rock and Blues Rock to create a melodic yet heavy sound.

sub_genres.name: Stoner Rock
sub_genres.description: Psychedelic timbres, raw production, and stylistic influence from Doom Metal and Heavy Psych.

sub_genres.name: Tropic√°lia
sub_genres.description: Blends Brazilian popular styles with the influence of Anglo-American Psychedelia; emerged as part of Brazil's late-1960s counterculture.
